snippet: British authorities announced on Friday that they had fined accountancy firm PricewaterhouseCoopers £1.4 million, or $2.2 million, for failing to safeguard client assets at JPMorgan Chase's securities business in London.
abstract: British authorities announced on Friday that they had fined accountancy firm PricewaterhouseCoopers £1.4 million, or $2.2 million, for failing to safeguard client assets at JPMorgan Chase's securities business in London.
lead_paragraph: LONDON -- British authorities announced on Friday that they had fined the accountancy firm PricewaterhouseCoopers £1.4 million, or $2.2 million, for failing to safeguard client assets at JPMorgan Chase's securities business in London.
